title: Falcon 9 rocket deploys SpaceX’s 3,000th Starlink internet satellite
summary: Fifty-two new satellites are on the way to join SpaceX’s Starlink internet network following a sky-lighting blastoff from the Kennedy Space Center Tuesday night, a mission that included the 3,000th spacecraft to launch into the Starlink constellation.

title: Blue Canyon Technologies to build Tomorrow.io constellation
summary: Blue Canyon Technologies won its largest constellation order to date, a contract with weather technology company Tomorrow.io.

title: SpaceX fires up Starship booster at orbital launch pad
summary: For the first time, SpaceX has static fired a Starship booster at its South Texas orbital launch pad, marking important milestones for...

title: U.S. Space Command basing decision approaching final stretch
summary: The head of U.S. Space Command said he expects a final decision to be made relatively soon on where the command will be permanently headquartered.

title: D-Orbit to deploy 20 Astrocast satellites over three years
summary: Italy’s D-Orbit said Aug. 9 that it would launch 20 nanosatellites over three years for Swiss startup Astrocast with its orbital transfer vehicle.

title: Aerospace develops low-cost optical ground network
summary: The Aerospace Corp. is establishing a network of remotely operated optical communications terminals to support existing and future small satellite missions.

title: Maxar to supply 14 satellites for U.S. military missile-tracking constellation
summary: Maxar Technologies announced Aug. 9 it was selected by L3Harris to manufacture 14 missile-detection satellites for the U.S. Space Development Agency.

title: Sidus Space could launch LizzieSat-1 without thrusters
summary: Sidus Space could launch LizzieSat-1 without thrusters if it can’t get safety clearances in time to deploy its first satellite from the International Space Station early next year.

title: Starlink Group 4-26 launches on Falcon 9 from LC-39A
summary: SpaceX’s Falcon 9 rocket launched from pad 39A at the Kennedy Space Center on Tuesday, carrying 52 Starlink satellites to Low Earth Orbit (LEO). These satellites will contribute to filling up the fourth shell of the Starlink constellation, which is now available in 36 countries to provide internet access to people around the globe.

title: China’s secretive space plane flies higher and longer than before
summary: So what is it doing up there? Secret, space-y stuff, of course.
